page.title: 08SUCKLEY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: { { THE PRESENT CHURCH IS DEDICATED TO ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST and replaces the earlier church which was demolished in 1877. It was designed by W.J.Hopkins and built at a cost of Â£5,000 in 1878. It is constructed of Cradley stone with a Bath stone dressing,in the Decorated style of the 14th century. It has a western tower, housing six bells. These were cast by Abraham and Abel Rudhall of Gloucester. Of the former church the pointed tomb recess and the Norman font were incorporated into the new building. The clock and chimes are a memorial to the parishioners who died in the First World War. An unusual feature is the tomb of William Henry Beard which enshrines his Crimean War medals from Sebastapol and Balaclava.
